title: Welbilt Gets $3.3 Billion Bid From Italy’s Ali Group
sub_head: The food-service-equipment maker had agreed in April to sell itself to Middleby
body:
Welbilt Inc., which agreed to sell itself in a $2.9 billion deal last month, has received a topping bid valuing the food-service-equipment maker at around $3.3 billion.
Italy’s Ali Group said Friday it made an all-cash offer to buy the company for $23 a share on May 25. The Wall Street Journal reported on the bid earlier Friday, sending Welbilt’s shares up over 20% in midday trading.
Welbilt agreed in April to sell itself to rival Middleby Corp. for 0.1240 Middleby share for each Welbilt share, an offer that at the time was worth around $20.69 a share.
Florida-based Welbilt’s shares closed Thursday at $19.92.
Ali Group, which also makes food-service equipment and operates globally, was founded in 1963 and is privately held.
